page.title: 16HALFKEY FARM
page.content: Mr. Pudges farm covers 121 acres. It's split into two parts, one eight miles away in Much Cowarne. The main part is situated just out of Malvern. He keeps sixty ewes, beef cattle, pigs and geese. Any pests such as foxes and crows he shoots with the help of his gun-dog, Chips. His other dog is a sheep dog. Mr. Pudge produces enough milk and eggs for his own use. Half his farm is grass and half arable. On his arable land he grows wheat, winter barley, winter oats and cider fruit. He finds the busiest time of the year Autumn when he has to do many things like silage making and hay making. Most of the animals are sent to Ledbury, Worcester and Hereford markets, but some are sold privately.
